conclusion: Analyze forces when ball A is at the highest point and exerts no force on the rod.
Ball A is at the highest point and ball B is at the lowest point on the rod.
Ball A exerts no force on the rod; only gravity acts on ball A.
Ball B exerts force due to its weight and centripetal force.
Centripetal force formula: \( F_c = m \omega^2 r \).
Radius for ball A is \( L \); radius for ball B is \( 2L \).
Gravity provides centripetal force for ball A: \( mg = m \omega^2 L \).
Ball B experiences gravity and centripetal force: \( F_{net} = mg + m \omega^2 (2L) \).
Substitute \( \omega^2 = \frac{g}{L} \) into the equation: \( F_{net} = mg + 2mg = 3mg \).
Force exerted by ball B on the rod is \( 3mg \).
